long_description: Official U.S. Coast Guard unit Facebook page

name: Acadia National Park
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of Acadia National Park.
long_description: Acadia National Park, as part of the National Park Service, cares for special places saved by the American people so that all may experience our heritage. We are one of 400+ national parks and help preserve historic places and open spaces.

name: Yosemite National Park Facebook
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of Yosemite National Park
long_description: Yosemite National Park is best known for its waterfalls, but within its nearly 1,200 square miles, you can find deep valleys, grand meadows, ancient giant sequoias, a vast wilderness area, and much more.

name: Grand Canyon-Parashant National Monument
short_description: This is the official Facebook page of Grand Canyon-Parashant National Monument.
long_description: Where the West Stays Wild:  Parashant provides a sense of solitude to those who venture into its isolated domain. The Monument's expansive landscape encompasses a chronicle of natural and cultural history that is just waiting to be discovered. For those prepared and equipped to explore the largely undeveloped landscape, a trip into the Parashant is a journey into the wild.The monument is located in Mohave County, Arizona encompassing 1,048,321 acres.

name: Pea Ridge National Military Park Facebook
short_description: This is the official Facebook page of Pea Ridge National Military Park.
long_description: Pea Ridge National Military Park was established to commemorate the Battle of Pea Ridge and preserve the site of the battle, the largest Civil War engagement west of the Mississippi River. This 4,300 acre park encompasses nearly 90% of the actual battlefield. Its numerous resources include archaeological sites, historic sites, structures, (site specific) collections, and cultural landscape features associated with the battle and the agrarian community found at Pea Ridge. This Facebook site seeks to link users and visitors from across the globe.

name: Virgin Islands National Park
short_description: This is the official Facebook account for Virgin Islands National Park
long_description:
Welcome to Virgin Islands National Parkкs official Facebook page. We hope this will be a place where people feel comfortable sharing information and experiences about Virgin Islands National Park with one another. 

We do not allow graphic, vulgar, profane, obscene, explicit, or racist comments or submissions, nor do we allow comments that are abusive, threatening, hateful, or intended to defame or violate the privacy of anyone or any organization. Comments that contain deliberate misinformation and off-topic comments may be removed. Repetitive posts copied and pasted by multiple users may be removed. People who post multiple, successive off-topic posts may be subject to page participation restrictions and/or removal from the page. 

Comments including phone numbers, e-mail addresses, residential addresses, or similar information will be removed.

We do not allow comments that may tend to compromise the safety or security of the public or public systems.

name: Virgin Islands Coral Reef National Monument
short_description: Virgin Islands Coral Reef National Monument is not actively posting to this site at this time. Please visit us on our sister site at Virgin Islands National Park.
long_description:
Virgin Islands Coral Reef National Monument is not actively posting to this site at this time. Please visit us on our sister site at Virgin Islands National Park.

Welcome to Virgin Islands Coral Reef National Monumentкs official Facebook page. We hope this will be a place where people feel comfortable sharing information and experiences about Virgin Islands Coral Reef National Monument with one another.

While this is an open forum, it is also a family friendly one, so please keep your comments and wall posts clean. Please be considerate of otherкs opinions. In addition to keeping it family friendly, we ask that you follow our posting guidelines here, as well as Facebookкs terms and policies. Be aware that if you do not comply, your message will be removed.

name: Chickamauga and Chattanooga National Military Park
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of Chickamauga and Chattanooga National Military Park
long_description: Chickamauga and Chattanooga National Military Park is the oldest and largest National Military Park in the United States.

name: Coronado National Memorial Facebook
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of Coronado National Memorial.
long_description: It was a journey of conquest and exploration, filled with wonder and cruelty. Inspired by rumors of vast quantities of gold, 339 soldiers and over 1100 Indian allies embarked on an epic journey through arid deserts and rugged mountains. They brought rich traditions and new technology into the southwest, irrevocably changing the lives of the native peoples and continuing to influence the area today. This page helps to interpret this history.

name: Kalaupapa National Historical Park
short_description: Official Facebook account of Kalaupapa National Historical Park.
long_description: Kalaupapa National Historical Park protects and preserves the history and stories of those people afflicted with Hansen's disease (leprosy) who were banished to the Kalaupapa peninsula from 1866 - 1969.

name: Ninety Six National Historic Site
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of Ninety Six National Historic Site
long_description: A unit of the National Park Service, Ninety Six tells the story of the Native Americans, Settlers, and Soldiers that lived and fought here.

name: Fredericksburg and Spotsylvania County Battlefields National Military Park
short_description: This is the official Facebook page of Fredericksburg and Spotsylvania National Military Park
long_description:
Soldiers, civilians, slaves--lives transformed by what took place here. Nearly 100,000 men fell killed or wounded in four battles spanning eighteen months. The constant presence or passage of armies for nearly two years mutilated the landscape, bringing agriculture to a virtual halt. In Fredericksburg, the Union army bombarded and then looted, leaving nearly 100 buildings destroyed and the fortunes of many families ruined. But amidst the destruction, slaves sought and found freedom. The sum total: the Civil War transformed this community socially, physically, and politically. 
Fredericksburg and Spotsylvania County Battlefields Memorial National Military Park encompasses four major Civil War battlefields: Fredericksburg (December 1862), Chancellorsville (May 1863), and Wilderness and Spotsylvania Court House (May 1864). The park also manages four major historic structures, two of them (Chatham and Jackson Shrine) open year-round. Ellwood and Salem Church are open seasonally.

name: Kenai Fjords National Park
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of Kenai Fjords National Park.
long_description: Kenai Fjords National Park is a glacial landscape of ice, tidewater glaciers, deeply chiseled fjords, and jagged peninsulas formed by the forces of the Harding Grewingk-Yalik icefields as they plunge into the sea.

name: Bering Land Bridge National Preserve
short_description: This is the official Facebook account for Bering Land Bridge National Preserve.
long_description: Welcome to the Bering Land Bridge National Preserve Facebook Page. We hope this will become a place where fans feel comfortable sharing information and experiences about Bering Land Bridge with one another.

name: Badlands National Park
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of Badlands National Park
long_description: Badlands National Park is famous for its striking scenery, but the steep-sided rock formations are more than just a source of beauty: they harbor one of the world's richest fossil beds. Badlands also preserves the largest expanse of mixed-grass prairie in the national park system. The park is home to diverse plants and animals, including prairie denizens like the American bison and pronghorn. Prairie dog colonies provide food and habitat for the endangered black-footed ferret, as well as other predators ranging from bobcats to golden eagles.

name: Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park
short_description: Klondike Gold Rush NHP in Seattle, WA is a historical park administered by the National Park Service and is the only unit of Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park located outside of Alaska.
long_description: The Seattle unit of the Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park preserves the story of the stampede to the Yukon gold fields and Seattle's crucial role in this event. The headlines of a Seattle newspaper on July 17, 1897, Gold! Gold! Gold! Gold! ignited dreams of easy riches in the minds of thousands as word of a rich gold strike in northwestern Canada. A dream that would prove all but dream. Open year round, roughly 65,000 visitors find their way to Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park each year. Most are surprised to find out that the Klondike Gold Rush isn't an Alaskan gold rush, but a story about 70,000 individuals headed to the Yukon Territory in Canada. Whether you see one or both of these films and the other interactive exhibits in the visitor center you will probably come away with a sense of wonderment and amazement that this event would have a lasting impact on the individuals that went the communities along the route to the gold fields.

name: Yellowstone National Park
short_description: The official Facebook page of Yellowstone National Park.
long_description: Visit Yellowstone and experience the world's first national park. Marvel at a volcano’s hidden power rising up in colorful hot springs, mudpots, and geysers. Explore mountains, forests, and lakes to watch wildlife and witness the drama of the natural world unfold. Discover the history that led to the conservation of our national treasures “for the benefit and enjoyment of the people.”

name: Fort Larned National Historic Site
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of Fort Larned National Historic Site
long_description: Fort Larned National Historic Site commemorates the significant role played by the fort in the opening of the West along the road to Santa Fe, often called the Santa Fe Trail. It was also an annuities distribution post and the first assignment of troopers from the 10th Cavalry - the famed Buffalo Soldiers.

name: Frederick Douglass National Historic Site
short_description: This is the official Facebook page of the Frederick Douglass National Historic Site.
long_description: The Frederick Douglass National Historic Site preserves and interprets Cedar Hill, where Frederick Douglass lived from 1877 until his death in 1895. Born into slavery, Douglass escaped to spend his life fighting for justice and equality for all people. His tireless struggle, brilliant words, and inclusive vision of humanity continue to inspire and sustain people today.

name: Cape Cod National Seashore
short_description: The official Facebook account of Cape Cod National Seashore
long_description: The national seashore includes forty miles of sandy beaches, salt marshes, ponds, and uplands. It also preserves historic buildings and landscapes. In addition to its habitats that provide for species diversity, and its cultural sites which interpret the story of human use, the national seashore provides for many recreational activities that beckon visitors: bicycling, wildlife viewing, swimming, hiking, canoeing, and kayaking. Exhibits, ranger-guided programs, films, and science and history presentations interpret the many facets of the national seashore.

name: Katmai National Park and Preserve
short_description: Facebook page for Katmai National Park and Preserve
long_description: Katmai National Monument was established in 1918 to protect the volcanically devastated region surrounding Mount Katmai and the Valley of Ten Thousand Smokes. Today, Katmai National Park and Preserve remains an active volcanic landscape, but it also protects 9,000 years of human history as well as important habitat for salmon and the thousands of brown bears that feed on them.

name: First State National Historical Park
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of First State National Historical Park
long_description: First State NHP tells the story of Delaware's role in the founding of the United States at seven sites throughout the state.

name: Tumacacori National Historical Park
short_description: This is the official Facebook page for Tumacacori National Historical Park.
long_description: Tumacácori NHP protects three Spanish colonial mission ruins in southern Arizona: Tumacácori, Guevavi, and Calabazas. The adobe structures are on three sites, with a visitor center at Tumacácori. These missions are among more than twenty established in the Pimería Alta by Father Kino and other Jesuits, and later expanded upon by Franciscan missionaries.

name: Padre Island National Seashore
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of Padre Island National Seashore.
long_description:
Welcome to the official Padre Island National Seashore Facebook page. 

Padre Island National Seashore was established by an Act of Congress (76 Stat. 650) in 1962. It is located on Padre Island, a barrier island in the Coastal Bend area of southern Texas. 
Containing 130,332 acres, the park preserves the longest undeveloped barrier island in the world with vitally important habitat for numerous rare, threatened and endangered species in perpetuity and makes this valuable part of Americas heritage available to thousands of visitors each year for their experience, enjoyment, understanding, and appreciation.

name: Fort Stanwix National Monument
short_description: The official Facebook page of the Fort that "never surrendered!" & associated parks. Follow & share your experience! #FortStanwix #OriskanySHS #SteubenSHS
long_description: Come visit this one of a kind National Park in downtown Rome, NY! For thousands of years the ancient trail that connects the Mohawk River and Wood Creek served as a vital link for those traveling between the Atlantic Ocean and Lake Ontario. This well-worn route through Oneida Indian territory carried goods and news, as well as diseases, to others far away. When Europeans arrived, they named this trail the Oneida Carrying Place and inaugurated a significant period in American history in which Fort Stanwix would play a vital role.

name: Martin Luther King, Jr. National Historical Park
short_description: The official Facebook Page for Martin Luther King, Jr. National Historical Park, a unit of the National Park Service.
long_description: Martin Luther King, Jr. NHP Facebook Page is an interpretive outreach forum to strengthen public connections to park resources and featured programs.

name: Cape Hatteras National Seashore
short_description: The official Cape Hatteras National Seashore Facebook page
long_description: Welcome to the official Cape Hatteras National Seashore Facebook page. We hope this will become a place where fans feel comfortable sharing information and experiences about Cape Hatteras National Seashore with one another.

name: Fort Raleigh National Historic Site
short_description: The official Fort Raleigh National Historic Site Facebook page
long_description: Welcome to the official Fort Raleigh National Historic Site Facebook page. We hope this will become a place where fans feel comfortable sharing information and experiences about Fort Raleigh National Historic Site with one another.

name: Weir Farm National Historic Site
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of Weir Farm National Historic Site.
long_description: Designed and preserved by artists, Weir Farm National Historic Site welcomes everyone to experience the power of creativity, art, and nature. Escape to the only national park dedicated to American painting and rediscover the beauty of light and color in everyday life.

name: Wright Brothers National Memorial
short_description: The official Facebook page of Wright Brothers National Memorial

name: Guadalupe Mountains National Park
short_description: This is the official Facebook page for Guadalupe Mountains National Park.
long_description:
Guadalupe Mountains National Park is the world's premier example of a fossil reef from the Permian Era.

Most people know that the National Park Service cares for national parks, a network of nearly 400 natural, cultural and recreational sites across the nation. The treasures in this system _ the first of its kind in the world _have been set aside by the American people to preserve, protect, and share, the legacies of this land.
The American system of national parks was the first of its kind in the world, and provides a living model for other nations wishing to establish and manage their own protected areas. The park service actively consults with these Nations, sharing what we've learned, and gaining knowledge from the experience of others.

name: Moores Creek National Battlefield Facebook
short_description: This is the official Facebook account for Moores Creek National Battlefield.
long_description: Moores Creek National Battlefield is the site of the first significant victory for the Patriots in the Revolutionary War. This battle ended Royal rule in North Carolina forever and helped pave the way for the signing of the Declaration of Independence.

name: Chamizal National Memorial
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of Chamizal National Memorial.
long_description: The Chamizal Convention of 1963 was a milestone in diplomatic relations between Mexico and the United States. Chamizal National Memorial was established to commemorate this treaty, which resulted in the peaceful settlement of a century-long boundary dispute. The Memorial provides visitors with an opportunity to better understand the culture of our borderland.

name: Olympic National Park
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of Olympic National Park.
long_description: Welcome to Olympic National Park's official Facebook page. We invite you to join in the conversation and share your thoughts, experiences, and images of Olympic National Park.

name: Homestead National Monument of America
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of Homestead National Monument of America.
long_description: This is the official Facebook account of Homestead National Monument of America.

name: El Malpais National Monument
short_description: The official Facebook account of El Malpais National Monument
long_description:
Edit
Experience an extreme land of lava flows bordered by sandstone ramparts in the high desert country of northwest New Mexico. This is the earth at its most primeval! Go to http://www.nps.gov/elma for maps, brochures, and more information.

name: National Park Service Fire and Aviation Management
short_description: Official account of Division of Fire & Aviation; posts on behalf of Branch of Aviation, Branch of Structural Fire, and Branch of Wildland Fire
long_description: National Park Service Fire and Aviation Management is made up of three operational groups: Aviation, Structural Fire, and Wildland Fire.The NPS aviation program assists in many different areas of the Service, including resource management, law enforcement, search and rescue, personnel transportation, and wildland fire support.The NPS structural fire program focuses on prevention, education, and suppression, so that the 27,000 buildings in the care of the National Park Service are there for future generations. Many are national icons such as the Statue of Liberty, Independence Hall, and homes of presidents.The NPS wildland fire program plans for the inevitable unwanted fire and promotes the use of fire as a land management tool where appropriate. The goal is to restore and maintain fire's role as a dynamic and necessary natural process where it is beneficial, and prevent or suppress fire where it has the potential to damage resources.

name: Joshua Tree National Park
short_description: This is the official Facebook page for Joshua Tree National Park.
long_description: Dark night skies, a rich cultural history, and surreal geologic features all add to the attraction of Joshua Tree National Park. Come see for yourself!

name: Glacier National Park
short_description: Welcome to the official Facebook page of Glacier National Park!
long_description: Glacier National Park is located in northwest  Montana, on the Canada_United States border with the Canadian provinces of Alberta and British Columbia. The park encompasses over 1 million acres (4,000 km2) and includes parts of two mountain ranges, over 130 named lakes, more than 1,200 different species of plants, 700+ miles of trails, over 270 species of birds, and nearly 70 species of mammals. This vast pristine ecosystem is the centerpiece of what has been referred to as the "Crown of the Continent Ecosystem", a region of protected land encompassing 16,000 square miles (41,000 km2).

name: Northern Colorado Plateau Network
short_description: This is the official Facebook page of the Northern Colorado Plateau Network.
long_description: As part of the National Park Service's Natural Resource Inventory & Monitoring Program, the Northern Colorado Plateau Network conducts long-term natural resource monitoring in 16 U.S. national parks in order to assess the condition of park ecosystems and develop a stronger scientific basis for natural resource stewardship and management. With this page, we share information about our mission and activities, notify the public about available reports and other information, and engage the public on topics related to science in the National Park Service.

name: Capitol Reef National Park
short_description: This is the official National Park Service Facebook page for Capitol Reef National Park.
long_description:
Located in south-central Utah in the heart of red rock country, Capitol Reef National Park is a hidden treasure filled with cliffs, canyons, domes and bridges in the Waterpocket Fold, a geologic monocline (a wrinkle on the earth) extending almost 100 miles.

www.nps.gov/care
www.twitter.com/CapitolReefNPS
www.facebook.com/CapitolReefNPS

In addition to keeping it family friendly, we ask that you follow our posting guidelines here. If you do not comply, your message will be removed.

long_description: An oasis in our nation's capital, the park offers hiking and biking trails, historical sites and exhibits, nature and planetarium programs and more.

short_description: The official Facebook account of Castillo de San Marcos National Monument
long_description: Started by the Spanish in 1672, the Castillo de San Marcos is the oldest masonry fort in North America.

short_description: This is the Facebook account for the Timucuan Preserve and Fort Caroline.
long_description: The Timucuan Preserve is a 46,000-acre area with individual park sites to visit. Each park site is unique for an aspect of natural or cultural history.

name: Knife River Indian Villages NHS

long_description: NPS unit that preserves and protects three historic Hidatsa Villages of the Mandan, Hidatsa, and Arikara Nation ancestors.

name: John Muir National Historic Site
short_description: Official Facebook page for the John Muir National Historic Site
long_description: This is the official Facebook Page for the John Muir National Historic Site in Martinez, CA. Visiting our park site is always free to the public.

name: Eugene O'Neill National Historic Site
short_description: Official Facebook page of the Eugene O'Neill National Historic Site
long_description: This is the official Facebook page of the Eugene O'Neill National Historic Site. Due to the location of this National Park, reservations are necessary.

name: Port Chicago Naval Magazine National Memorial
short_description: Official Facebook page of the Port Chicago Naval Magazine National Memorial
long_description: The Port Chicago disaster was a deadly munitions explosion that occurred on July 17, 1944, at the Port Chicago Naval Magazine in Port Chicago, California, United States.

name: Sonoran Desert Network & Desert Research Learning Center
short_description: This is the official Facebook page of the Sonoran Desert Network.
long_description: As part of the National Park Service's Natural Resource Inventory & Monitoring Program, the Sonoran Desert Network conducts long-term natural resource monitoring in 11 U.S. national parks in order to assess the condition of park ecosystems and develop a stronger scientific basis for natural resource stewardship and management. We use this page to share information about our mission and activities, announce the availability of new reports and other communications, and engage the public relative to science in the national parks.

name: Rosie the Riveter/WWII Home Front National Historical Park
short_description: Official Facebook page of the Rosie the Riveter/WWII Home Front National Historical Park
long_description: This is the official Facebook page for "Rosie the Riveter/WWII Home Front National Historical Park", part of the National Park Service. Our site covers the many stories involved in the WWII Home Front in Richmond, California. Admission to our Visitor Education Center is Free of charge.

name: Saratoga National Historical Park
short_description: Official Facebook for Saratoga National Historical Park; Turning Point of the American Revolutionary War
long_description: Saratoga National Historical Park preserves and interprets the grounds that witnessed the world-changing Battles of Saratoga, called the "Turning Point of the American Revolution" and the "most important battle of the last 1000 years." Our Facebook account provides information about upcoming park events and projects, historical content relating to the American War for Independence and the 1777 Battles of Saratoga, and serves as an outlet for virtual visitors to share their experiences.

name: Keweenaw National Historical Park
short_description: This is the official Facebook page of Keweenaw National Historical Park.
long_description:
Keweenaw NHP was established to preserve and interpret the story of the rise, domination and decline of the regionкs copper mining industry. Unlike many parks, however, the U.S. Congress legislated that the National Park Service and the park's advisory commission partner with sites owned and operated by state and local governments, private businesses and nonprofit organizations to achieve this goal. The Keweenaw Heritage Sites program, administered by the Keweenaw National Historical Park Advisory Commission, is one aspect of this partnership.
Heritage sites operate independently of the National Park Service. Sites stretch along the length of the Keweenaw Peninsula, from Copper Harbor to south of Ontonagon.
At the Calumet Visitor Center visitors spend anywhere from a half hour to several hours touring the facility. Displayed are hundreds of artifacts, objects, and photos. There is also a visitor information desk where park rangers will answer questions and provide further insight into the exhibits.

name: Scotts Bluff National Monument
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of Scotts Bluff National Monument
long_description: Established in 1919 to preserve the historical, geological and cultural integrity of Scotts Bluff and the emigrant trails used for westward expansion. External links on this site do not constitute official endorsement by the NPS or Dept. of Interior.

name: Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park - Skagway, Alaska
short_description: This is the official account of Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park
long_description: This is the official account of Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park

name: Wolf Trap National Park for the Performing Arts
short_description: This is the OFFICIAL Facebook page for Wolf Trap National Park for the Performing Arts. This page is administered and maintained by NPS employees.
long_description: Exciting performances, picnics, and a beautiful setting are just part of your experience at Wolf Trap National Park for the Performing Arts. Through the cooperative effort and partnership of the National Park Service and the Wolf Trap Foundation, you can enjoy music, dance, and a variety of performances throughout the year. Together, they offer festivals in the park and performances in the summer at the Filene Center. The National Park Service (NPS) operates the park and keeps it active all year with backstage tours, interpretive activities, educational programs, and the annual Holiday Sing-a-Long program. The park is open daily except Thanksgiving Day, December 25 and January 1. It closes at dark except for patrons of the Filene Center performances.

name: SagamoreHillNHS
short_description: This is the office Facebook account of Sagamore Hill National Historic Site.
long_description: Sagamore Hill National Historic site preserves the home and story of Theodore Roosevelt and his family on Long Island from 1885 until his death in 1919. The park offers historic house tours, exhibits on the life of Theodore Roosevelt and his family members. The park also preserves nearly 80 acres of the original farm and woodland including a nature trail and beach on Cold Spring Harbor.

name: New Bedford Whaling National Historical Park
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of New Bedford Whaling National Historical Park
long_description: New Bedford was the mid 19th century preeminent whaling port and for a time –the richest city in the world.” Come stroll down cobblestone streets, visit the worldкs largest whaling museum, tour a whaling merchantкs home and whaleman's chapel, and walk a 19th century schoonerкs decks. Walk in the footsteps of Herman Melville and Frederick Douglass and learn about a remarkable era.

name: Harpers Ferry National Historical Park
short_description: Welcome to the official Facebook page for Harpers Ferry National Historical Park. This page is maintained by National Park Service employees at Harpers Ferry National Historical Park. For more information visit http://www.nps.gov/hafe
long_description: Welcome to the official Facebook page for Harpers Ferry National Historical Park. This page is maintained by National Park Service employees at Harpers Ferry National Historical Park. For more information visit http://www.nps.gov/hafe

name: Grand Canyon National Park
short_description: The official Facebook page of Grand Canyon National Park.
long_description:
Welcome to the Grand Canyon National Park Facebook Page. We hope this will become a place where fans feel comfortable sharing information and experiences about Grand Canyon National Park with one another.   
"The Grand Canyon fills me with awe. It is beyond comparisonгbeyond description...Do nothing to mar its grandeur...Keep it for your children and your children's children, and all who come after you." -Theodore Roosevelt

name: Fort Vancouver National Historic Site
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of Fort Vancouver National Historic Site.
long_description: Fort Vancouver National Historic Site, the only unit of the national park system in the Portland/Vancouver Metropolitan Area, is the Pacific Northwest's premier historical archaeology and living history site and home of Pearson Air Museum.

name: Pearson Air Museum
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of Pearson Air Museum, a part of Fort Vancouver National Historic Site.
long_description: Pearson Air Museum and the Jack Murdock Aviation Center help visitors connect to the history of aviation at Pearson Field. Free to all visitors.

name: Mary McLeod Bethune Council House National Historic Site
short_description: This is the official Facebook page of the Mary McLeod Bethune Council House National Historic Site, administered by the National Park Service.
long_description:
Mary McLeod Bethune achieved her greatest national and international recognition at the Washington, DC townhouse at 1318 Vermont Avenue NW.

This Second Empire row house in the Logan Circle neighborhood of Washington, D.C. once belonged to educator, civil rights activist, and presidential adviser Dr. Mary McLeod Bethune, and served as the national headquarters for the National Council of Negro Women, Inc. (NCNW). She purchased the house in 1943. Mary McLeod Bethune rose from a regional leader in the Civil Rights Movement to one with national prominence as she led the NCNW and numerous other organizations. To understand Mary McLeod Bethune as only a champion of civil rights, though, would be to ignore her longstanding commitment to the rights of women and to education. Hers was a life of civic engagement spent working for the greater good. The Mary McLeod Bethune Council House National Historic Site (NHS) tells the story of her life in the house where she lived and worked from 1943 to 1949.

name: Carter G. Woodson Home National Historic Site
short_description: This is the official Facebook page of the Carter G. Woodson Home National Historic Site, administered by the National Park Service.
long_description:
Woodson lived, researched, preserved rare collections of history, and founded the Association for the Study of Negro Life and History at the Washington, DC row house at 1538 9th Street NW.

The Carter G. Woodson Home National Historic Site highlights Dr. Carter G. Woodson's contributions to the nation. Around the turn of the 20th century as he began his own academic career, Woodson noticed a glaring hole in the educational system in the United States. The public knew very little about the role of African Americans in American history, and schools were not including African American history in their curriculum. He worked tirelessly throughout his life to remedy this problem becoming nationally recognized as –the Father of Black History.” Woodson exposed the American public and education system to the lives and history of Americans of African descent and their profound impact on American society through such endeavors as founding Negro History Week in 1926, and establishing ASALH and the Associated Publishers.

name: Big South Fork NRRA Facebook
short_description: The official Facebook account of Big South Fork NRRA.
long_description: Encompassing 125,000 acres of the Cumberland Plateau, Big South Fork National River and Recreation Area protects the free-flowing Big South Fork of the Cumberland River and its tributaries. The area boasts miles of scenic gorges and sandstone bluffs, is rich with natural and historic features and has been developed to provide visitors with a wide range of outdoor recreational activities.

name: Obed Wild & Scenic River Facebook
short_description: The official Facebook page of Obed Wild & Scenic River.
long_description: Obed Wild & Scenic River was established to preserve one of the last free-flowing, wild river systems in the Eastern United States. This park is characterized by rugged and primitive terrain, rare and threatened ecosystems, exceptional waters, and opportunities for challenging recreational activities.

name: Lyndon B. Johnson National Historical Park Facebook
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of Lyndon B. Johnson National Historical Park.
long_description:
LBJ NHP is divided into 2 separate units. The Johnson City Unit, located in Johnson City, Texas, consists of the park headquarters and visitor center, Lyndon Johnson's childhood home, and the Johnson Settlement containing his grandparents frontier log cabin.

The LBJ Ranch Unit preserves President Johnson's ranch. Within the ranch district are Lyndon Johnson's birthplace, the Johnson family cemetery, and the Texas White House from which he ran the country for >25% of his presidency.

The LBJ Ranch is still a working cattle ranch and LBJ NHP does preserve the LBJ bloodline in our Herefords.

name: Manhattan Project National Historical Park Facebook
short_description: The official Facebook account of the Manhattan Project NHP.
long_description: This site tells the story of the people, events, science, and engineering that led to the creation of the atomic bomb, which helped end World War II.

name: Cape Lookout National Seashore
short_description: The official facebook account for Cape Lookout National Seashore
long_description: Welcome to the official Facebook page for Cape Lookout National Seashore. For more information on the park, please visit our website at http://www.nps.gov/calo or contact the park at 252-728-2250.

name: Fort Matanzas National Monument
short_description: Official Facebook page for Fort Matanzas National Monument
long_description: Coastal Florida was a major field of conflict as European nations fought for control in the New World. As part of this struggle, Fort Matanzas guarded St. Augustineкs southern river approach. The colonial wars are over, but the monument is still protectingгnot just the historic fort, but also the wild barrier island and the plants and animals who survive there amidst a sea of modern development.

name: Casa Grande Ruins National Monument
short_description: Offficial Facebook page for Casa Grande Ruins National Monument.
long_description: Official Facebook page for Casa Grande Ruins National Monument.

name: Heritage & Historic Preservation - NPS
short_description: An official collaboartive account for National Park Service (NPS) programs that support and assist the preservation and promotion of our shared heritage and historic properties in communities across the nation.
long_description:
The National Park Service's Cultural Resources programs are dedicated to preserving history, celebrating our diverse heritage, facilitating heritage-based education, and providing grants and technical assistance. We are excited to share success stories and preservation news with you through this collaborative space.

The programs providing regular content for this page include:
- Certified Local Governments
- Historic Preservation Grants
- National Heritage Areas
- Technical Preservation Services
- Teaching with Historic Places

name: Mesa Verde National Park
short_description: This is the official Mesa Verde National Park Facebook Page.
long_description: Mesa Verde, Spanish for "green table," offers a spectacular look into the lives of the Ancestral Pueblo people who made it their home for over 700 years.

name: Channel Islands National Park
short_description: Official Facebook page of Channel Islands National Park.
long_description: Close to the California Mainland...Yet Worlds ApartChannel Islands National Park encompasses five remarkable islands and their ocean environment, preserving and protecting a wealth of natural and cultural resources. Isolation over thousands of years has created unique animals, plants, and archeological resources found nowhere else on Earth and helped preserve a place where visitors can experience coastal southern California as it once was.

name: Hagerman Fossil Beds Facebook page
short_description: Welcome to the official Facebook page for Hagerman Fossil Beds National Monument. If you are looking for the official source of information about Hagerman Fossil Beds National Monument, please visit our homepage at: http://www.nps.gov/hafo
long_description: Hagerman Fossil Beds National Monument preserves the largest concentration of Hagerman Horse (Equus simplicidens) fossils in North America - 30 complete horse fossils and portions of 200 individual horses. Internationally significant, the Monument protects fossils from the late Pliocene epoch (3 - 4 mya) including over 220 species of plants and animals! Hagerman Fossil Beds is nationally and internationally significant for its world-class paleontological resources

name: Fort Sumter and Fort Moultrie National Historical Park Facebook
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of Fort Sumter and Fort Moultrie National Historical Park.
long_description: The Official Facebook Page for Fort Sumter and Fort Moultrie NHP commemorates historical events in Charleston Harbor from 1776-1947.

name: Guilford Courthouse National Military Park
short_description: The official Facebook page of Guilford Courthouse National Military Park.
long_description:
On March 15, 1781. the largest, most hotly-contested battle of the Revolutionary War's Southern Campaign was fought at the small North Carolina backcounty hamlet of Guilford Courthouse.

We are the stewards of Guilford Courthouse National Military Park, honoring the memory of those who fought and died here. We strive to educate present and future generations about the Battle of Guilford Courthouse and the American Revolution. We are dedicated to the preservation of natural and cultural resources and the safety of all who visit and serve here.

name: Northeast Temperate Network
short_description: Official FB page for NETN.
long_description: Page where events and activities of NETN are shared with the public.

name: Scotts Bluff National Monument
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of Scotts Bluff National Monument
long_description: Established by presidential proclamation in 1919, Scotts Bluff National Monument is named for fur trader / trapper Hiram Scott.

name: River Raisin National Battlefield Park
short_description: This is the official account of the River Raisin National Battlefield Park Facebook account
long_description: River Raisin National Battlefield Park preserves, commemorates, and interprets the January 1813 battles of the War of 1812 and their aftermath in Monroe and Wayne counties in SE Michigan. The Battle resulted in the greatest victory for Tecumsehкs American Indian confederation and the greatest defeat for the U.S. The resulting rally cry –Remember the Raisin” spurred support for the rest of the war.

name: Roger Williams National Memorial
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of Roger Williams National Memorial
long_description: Roger Williams National Memorial commemorates the life of the founder of Rhode Island and a champion of the ideals of religious freedom and liberty of conscience. Williams, banished from Massachusetts for his beliefs, established the first civil society in the new world in 1636 on the site of the present-day Memorial. There is free parking located on the Canal Street side of the park,just down the hill from the Statehouse. There is also metered parking on North Main St., adjacent to the park.

name: Minidoka National Historic Site Facebook page
short_description: Minidoka NHS highlights the violation of civil liberties during WWII.Visit us at www.nps.gov/miin for more information.
long_description: The attack on Pearl Harbor intensified hostility towards Japanese Americans. As wartime hysteria mounted, President Roosevelt signed Executive Order 9066 forcing over 120,000 West Coast persons of Japanese ancestry (Nikkei) to leave their homes, jobs, and lives behind and move to one of ten Relocation Centers. This single largest forced relocation in U.S. history is Minidoka's story.

name: Charles Pinckney National Historic Site Facebook Page
short_description: This is the official Facebook page for Charles Pinckney National Historic Site.
long_description: The official Facebook page of Charles Pinckney National Historic Site shares stories of a 28-acre remnant of Pinckneyкs coastal plantation, Snee Farm, and communicates his legacy as a framer and signer of the United States Constitution and leading public servant of the new nation. We also share stories about the history of Snee Farm, including the experience of its inhabitants, enslaved as well as free and the natural and cultural environment of modern-day Snee Farm.

name: Blackstone River Valley National Historical Park
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of Blackstone River Valley National Historical Park
long_description: Blackstone River Valley National Historical Park celebrates the role of the region in the industrialization of America. Slater Mill, in Pawtucket, RI, was America's first successful water-powered cotton spinning mill. Slater's success spurred the development of a new industrial age, first across the Blackstone River Valley and then across the Nation. Today you can visit the park to explore the mill villages, waterways, and transportation systems that tell the story of America at work.

name: Blue Ridge Parkway
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of Blue Ridge Parkway.
long_description: The route of the Blue Ridge Parkway follows mountain and valley landscapes to link Shenandoah and Great Smoky Mountains National Parks. Its location was selected to provide the best in a variety of scenic, historic, and natural features that evoke the regional image of the central and southern Appalachian Mountains. To maximize scenic views and give visitors the impression that they are in a park with boundaries to the horizon, the Parkway was located in mountainous terrain that roads would normally have avoided.The Parkway extends 469 miles through the Blue Ridge, Black, Great Craggy, Great Balsam, and Plot Balsam Mountains. It is known for spectacular mountain and valley vistas, quiet pastoral scenes, sparkling waterfalls, colorful flowers and foliage displays, and interpretation of mountain history and culture.

name: Isle Royale National Park Facebook Page
short_description: Your Invitation to a Superior Wilderness Experience!
long_description: Explore a rugged, isolated island, far from the sights and sounds of civilization. Surrounded by Lake Superior, Isle Royale offers unparalleled solitude and adventures for backpackers, hikers, boaters, kayakers, canoeists and scuba divers. Here, amid stunning scenic beauty, you'll find opportunities for reflection and discovery, and make memories that last a lifetime.

name: LassenNPS
short_description: Official Facebook page of Lassen Volcanic National Park
long_description: Lassen Volcanic National Park, established in 1916, is located in northeastern California. The park provides opportunities for visitors to learn about volcanism and other park phenomena and enjoy various recreation pursuits such as sightseeing, camping, picnicking, and hiking. Over 75 percent of the park is congressionally designated wilderness.

name: Monocacy National Battlefield
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of Monocacy National Battlefield
long_description: Known as the "Battle That Saved Washington", the battle of Monocacy on July 9, 1864 between 15,000 Confederate forces under General Jubal Early, and 6,600 Union forces under General Lew Wallace, marked the last campaign of the Confederacy to carry the war into the north. One of the objectives of this campaign was to capture Washington, D.C.

name: Petrified Forest NPS
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of Petrified Forest National Park
long_description: Petrified Forest is a Science Park! Best known for globally significant Late Triassic fossils, the park attracts many researchers. Geologists study the multi-hued Chinle Formation. Archeologists research over 13,000 years of history. Biologists explore one of the best remnants of native Arizona grassland. Air quality is an ongoing study in the park. Discover your own passion at Petrified Forest!

name: Saint Croix National Scenic Riverway
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of St. Croix National Scenic Riverway.
long_description: Discover the St. Croix National Scenic Riverway--a national park that protects over 200 miles of wild and scenic river corridor in the upper Midwest.

name: Niobrara National Scenic River
short_description: This is the official Facebook page for Niobrara National Scenic River.
long_description: This is not your ordinary river. Designated by Congress in 1991; Niobrara NSR is a crossroads of 6 distinct ecosystems where high water quality supports diverse life & fossil-filled sandstone cliffs host over 200 waterfalls. www.nps.gov/niob

name: Marsh-Billings-Rockefeller National Historical Park Facebook
short_description: This is the official facebook page for Marsh-Billings-Rockefeller National Historical Park
long_description: Nestled among the rolling hills and pastures of eastern-central Vermont, the Marsh-Billings-Rockefeller National Historical Park is the only national park to tell the story of conservation history and the evolving nature of land stewardship in America. The boyhood home of George Perkins Marsh, one of America's first conservationists, and later the home of Frederick Billings, the property was given to the American people by its most recent owners, Laurance S. and Mary F. Rockefeller. The park was created by an Act of Congress and signed into law by President George Bush on August 26, 1992.

name: National Park Service Chesapeake Bay
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of the NPS Chesapeake Office
long_description: This is the official Facebook account of the NPS Chesapeake Office

name: North Cascades National Park Service Complex
short_description: This is the official Facebook account for North Cascades National Park Service Complex (North Cascades National Park, Ross Lake National Recreation Area, Lake Chelan National Recreation Area)
long_description: North Cascades National Park Service Complex protects 750 square miles of jagged peaks, deep valleys, cascading waterfalls, and over 300 glaciers of some of the wildest lands in the contiguous United States. Today, the park looks ahead to its fifth decade and to the National Park Service's centennial in 2016.

name: Great Lakes Network (Government Organization)
short_description: This is the official Facebook page for the Great Lakes I&M Network.
long_description: As part of the National Park Service, Great Lakes Network scientists conduct natural resource monitoring in nine Midwestern national parks. Our Facebook page is a way for us to share short communications, photos, and video about the work we are doing in the nine Network parks.

name: Lincoln Home National Historic Site
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of Lincoln Home National Historic Site.
long_description: Purpose and Goals: -	Build networks of people with a common interest in Lincoln, so they might create a dialogue about Lincolnкs legacy and related topics-	Inform audiences of the mission of Lincoln Home NHS and the National Park Service-	Increase interest in, and visitation to, the Lincoln Home-	Give visitors a way to prepare for their visits-	Enable visitors to post comments, input, and reflections about their Lincoln Home visit-	Provide easily accessible park information about events, activities, and closuresContent of Facebook Site:-	Lincoln Homeкs mission and themes-	Itкs association with the larger National Park Service-	Park events and things to do while visiting-	Issues that require input from the public-	Trivia questions, –throwback” pictures, and other interpretation -	Comments from the public concerning their visits-	Multimedia (pictures, video) of the park and its various aspects

name: Tonto National Monument
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of Tonto National Monument.
long_description: The Salado Phenomena, 700 years ago, blended ideas of neighboring Native American cultures to emerge a unique and vibrant society. Tonto National Monument showcases two Salado-style cliff dwellings. Colorful pottery, woven cotton cloth, and other artifacts tell a story of people living and using resources from the northern Sonoran Desert from 1250 to 1450 CE.

name: Cane River Creole National Historical Park
short_description: The is the official Facebook page of Cane River Creole National Historical Park
long_description: Experience history when you visit Cane River Creole National Historical Park's Oakland and Magnolia Plantations, located near historic Natchitoches, LA. Natchitoches, established in 1714, is the oldest permanent settlement in the Louisiana Purchase territory.

name: NPS Climate Change Response
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of the NPS Climate Change Response Program
long_description: This is the official Facebook account of the NPS Climate Change Response Program

name: Oregon Caves National Monument & Preserve
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of Oregon Caves National Monument and Preserve.
long_description: –The stalagmite and stalactite formations of this cave surpass anything ever dreamed of Д nothing I ever beheld in Nature before so completely overcame me with suggestions of sublimity and beauty.” гWilliam Fidler 1877 on his first trip to the cave.  If you're looking for the official source of information about Oregon Caves National Monument, please visit our homepage at http://www.nps.gov/orca/

name: Jewel Cave National Monument
short_description: This is the official Facebook Page of Jewel Cave National Monument.
long_description:
Jewel Cave National Monument is a Facebook fan page established by the National Park Service as an interpretive outreach forum intending to develop, maintain and strengthen online connections with visitors. Intended to provide communication regarding the happenings at the monument and allow visitors to share experiences with each other.

If you wish to express a formal or official comment to the monument, please contact the park directly at 11149 US Highway 16, Bldg. B12, Custer, SD 57730, (605) 673-8300.

name: Prince William Forest Park
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of Prince William Forest Park.
long_description: Prince William Forest Park is a 15,000 acre forested oasis, located 35 miles south of Washington, DC. 21 miles of bicycle trails and 37 miles of hiking trails criss-cross Quantico Creek and its tributaries.

name: Tallgrass Prairie National Preserve
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of Tallgrass Prairie National Preserve
long_description: Welcome to Tallgrass Prairie National Preserve's Facebook page. Our goal is to share what's happening at the preserve and what makes the tallgrass prairie unique and significant.Tallgrass prairie once covered 170 million acres of North America. Within a generation the vast majority was developed primarily for agriculture. Today less than 4% remains, mostly here in the Kansas Flint Hills. The preserve protects a nationally significant remnant of the once vast tallgrass prairie and its natural and cultural resources.Tallgrass Prairie National Preserve is a public/private partnership dedicated to preserving and enhancing a nationally significant remnant of the tallgrass prairie ecosystem and the processes that sustain it; preserving and interpreting the cultural resources of the preserve and the heritage associated with the ranch property; and offering opportunities for education, inspiration, and enjoyment through public access to its geological, ecological, scenic, and historical features.

name: Big Bend National Park
short_description: Official Facebook page of Big Bend National Park and Rio Grande Wild & Scenic River. Located in SW Texas 4 hours South of Midland, TX.
long_description:
There is a place in Far West Texas where night skies are dark as coal and rivers carve temple-like canyons in ancient limestone. Here, at the end of the road, hundreds of bird species take refuge in a solitary mountain range surrounded by weather-beaten desert. Tenacious cactus bloom in sublime southwestern sun, and diversity of species is the best in the country. This magical place is Big Bend.
For specific location and fee information, please visit our website- www.nps.gov/bibe

name: Lowell National Historical Park Facebook
short_description: This is the official Facebook page of Lowell National Historical Park. Explore Lowell, a living monument to the dynamic story of the Industrial Revolution.
long_description: Discover the continuing revolution. Lowellкs water-powered textile mills catapulted the nation _ including immigrant families and early female factory workers _ into an uncertain new industrial era. Nearly 200 years later, the changes that began in this vibrant city still reverberate in our shifting global economy. Explore this legacy at Lowell National Historical Park with interactive programs, unique museum experiences, canal boat tours, cultural festivals, and online resources.

name: Fort Smith National Historic Site
short_description: Official Facebook account for Fort Smith National Historic Site
long_description: At Fort Smith National Historic Site you can walk where soldiers drilled, pause along the Trail of Tears, and stand where justice was served. The park includes the remains of two frontier forts and the Federal Court for the Western District of Arkansas. Judge Isaac C. Parker presided over the court for 21 years.

name: Sitka National Historical Park
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of Sitka National Historical Park.
long_description: Sitka National Historical Park, Alaska's oldest federally designated park, was established as a federal park in 1890. http://www.nps.gov/sitk/

name: Lava Beds National Monument
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of Lava Beds National Monument.
long_description: Lava Beds National Monument is a place where you can smell the sage and juniper, listen to birds and hike miles of lava flows or developed trails. Volcanic eruptions on the Medicine Lake shield volcano have created an incredibly rugged landscape punctuated by cinder cones, lava flows, spatter cones, lava tube caves and pit craters. Explore caves created by the sudden cooling of lava flows, or visit the site of the only Indian war in California at the historic Captain Jackкs Stronghold. The Stronghold, a natural lava fortress, is where a small band of 53 warriors and their families led by Captain Jack held off a force 20 times its size for five months. Just south of the Lava Beds is Medicine Lake кs volcano, one of the largest shield volcanoes in the world. In actual mass, this volcano is larger than Mt. Shasta . Millions of eruptions over half a million years were gentle rather than explosive, covering more than 750 square miles of landscape with lava.

name: Tule Lake Unit, WWII Valor in the Pacific National Monument
short_description: This is the official Facebook account for Tule Lake Unit, WWII Valor in the Pacific National Monument
long_description: The World War II Valor in the Pacific National Monument was established on December 5, 2008 serving as a reminder of the hardships endured on the home front during World War II, with monuments in California, Hawaii, and Alaska. The two sites of the Tule Lake Unit, the Tule Lake Segregation Center, located in Newell, CA and Camp Tulelake, located along Hill Road just west of Tulelake, CA, represent the unique history of the small community living here and the nation during this period.

name: Perry's Victory and International Peace Memorial
short_description: The official Facebook account of Perry's Victory and International Peace Memorial
long_description: Perry's Victory & International Peace Memorial stands for two purposes:- (1.) To remember Commodore Oliver Hazard Perry and the men who fought alongside him in the Battle of Lake Erie during the American War of 1812- (2.) To celebrate the international peace that began at the end of that war, when the United States, Great Britain and Canada set aside their weapons with the Treaty of Ghent in 1814 --- a peace that has lasted for nearly two hundred years and has created the world's longest friendly border between two nations (the US and Canada).

name: Glen Canyon National Recreation Area
short_description: Welcome to the official Facebook page for Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and Rainbow Bridge National Monument. It is our intent that you will be able to use this site to stay up to date, share photos and experiences.
long_description: Encompassing over 1.2 million acres, Glen Canyon National Recreation Area (NRA) offers unparalleled opportunities for water-based & backcountry recreation. The recreation area stretches for hundreds of miles from Lees Ferry in Arizona to the Orange Cliffs of southern Utah, encompassing scenic vistas, geologic wonders, and a vast panorama of human history.

name: Antietam National Battlefield
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of Antietam National Battlefield
long_description: Welcome to the official Facebook page for Antietam National Battlefield. This page is maintained by National Park Service employees at Antietam National Battlefield. For more information visit http://www.nps.gov/anti

name: Chattahoochee River National Recreation Area
short_description: Welcome to the official Facebook page for Chattahoochee River National Recreation Area. If you're looking for the official source of information about Chattahoochee River National Recreation Area, please visit our homepage at www.nps.gov/chat.
long_description:
Chattahoochee River National Recreation Area is a series of parklands along a 48-mile stretch of the Chattahoochee River--a place rich in natural and human history, each influenced by the river's pervasive force. Usually clear, cold, and slow-moving, the river sometimes plunges as a muddy torrent through its rockbound shoals. For centuries people have been drawn to the river for food and transportation and for power to sustain the mills, factories and homes built along its banks.

Today the river attracts us for different reasons. People come to float down the river, hike the trails along its banks, play touch football in the meadows, and simply relax. In its role as and outdoor classroom, the park promises to expand your horizons through nature walks exploring its plants and birds and the river.

name: Vanderbilt Mansion National Historic Site
short_description: Official facebook page for Vanderbilt Mansion National Historic Site. Frederick W. Vanderbilt's Hyde Park Estate 1895-1938
long_description: Vanderbilt Mansion NHS, in terms of architecture, interiors, mechanical systems, road systems and landscape, is a remarkably complete example of a gilded-age country place, illustrating the political, economic, social, cultural, and demographic changes that occurred as America industrialized in the years after the Civil War.

name: Midwest National Parks
short_description: The official Facebook page for the National Park Service Midwest Regional Office. Find Your park in the Midwest!
long_description: Welcome to the official Facebook page for your Midwest National Parks. Expansive and diverse, the Midwest hosts 61 national parks, preserves, monuments and historic sites. The National Park Service cares for special places saved by the American people so that all may experience our heritage

name: Home of Franklin D. Roosevelt National Historic Site
short_description: President Franklin D. Roosevelt's Hyde Park, New York Home (Springwood)
long_description:
"All that is within me cries out to go back to my home on the Hudson River" FDR

This quote captures FDR's connection to Springwood, the estate that he loved & the place he considered home. The first US Presidential Library was started by FDR here. Visit the Home of FDR and Presidential Library & Museum to learn about the only President elected to four terms.

name: Eleanor Roosevelt National Historic Site
short_description: Eleanor Roosevelt chose Val-Kill for her retreat, her office, her home, and her "laboratory" for social change during the prominent and influential period of her life from 1924 until her death in 1962.
long_description:
–The greatest thing I have learned is how good it is to come home again,” Eleanor Roosevelt 

This simple statement expresses her love for the modest house she called Val-Kill. The only National Historic Site dedicated to a first lady, Val-Kill welcomes visitors in the style of Mrs. Roosevelt. Come and be part of the entire Roosevelt Experience at Eleanor Roosevelt's Val-Kill.

name: Pinnacles National Park
short_description: Official Facebook account for Pinnacles National Park.
long_description: Pinnacles National Park embraced social media in 2012. Facebook is currently being used as an informational media outlet with an interactive element for the general public.

name: Fort Washington Park
short_description: This is the official facebook account for Fort Washington Pakr
long_description: Sharing of information about the park's history, programs/activities in the park, photos, and other NPS relevant data.

name: Upper Delaware Facebook
short_description: Official Facebook page for Upper Delaware Scenic and Recreational RIver
long_description: Upper Delaware Scenic and Recreational River stretches 73.4 miles along the New York and Pennsylvania border.  The longest and one of the cleanest free-flowing (undammed) rivers in the eastern United States.

name: Piscataway Park
short_description: This is the official Facebook account for Piscataway Park
long_description: Information about the park's history, photos of the various sites and animals, disseminate information about hours of the park and our partner the Accokeek Foundation and program at National Colonial Farm.

name: NPSCLP
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of the NPS Park Cultural Landscapes Program.
long_description: Cultural landscapes are defined as any lands - public or private, large or small - with historic significance (or importance in American history) and historic integrity (or physical authenticity). These lands are eligible for listing or are listed on the National Register of Historic Places, and the NPS has a Federal government leadership role in preserving them. Our nation has a rich legacy of cultural landscapes; from scenic parkways to battlefields, formal gardens to cattle ranches, cemeteries and pilgrimage routes to village squares and industrial areas. The program encourages the use of social media technologies to enhance communication, collaboration, and information exchange in support of the preservation mission of the NPS.

name: Lewis and Clark National Historical Park
short_description: This is the official Facebook Account of Lewis and Clark National Historical Park
long_description:
Lewis and Clark National Historical Park consists of seven units in Washington and Oregon, for a total of 1,916 acres.
Visitation: We are open from 9 a.m.- 6 p.m. in the summer and 9-5 after Labor Day.  Most of the 250,000 visitors per year come to see the reconstructed Fort Clatsop, home of the Corps of Discovery during the winter of 1805-1806. 

Natural Resources: The park preserves a variety of ecosystems from coastal dunes, estuarine mudflats and tidal marshes to shrub wetlands, temperate rainforests and swamps. Extensive wetlands in the park include fringing saltmarshes on the lower Columbia River, the tidally-influenced lower Lewis and Clark River and many low-gradient brackish sloughs and marshes. 

For more information about recreational opportunities, ranger led living history programs, wildlife, educational field trips and special events go to: www.nps.gov/lewi

short_description: This is the official Facebook account of San Francisco Maritime National Historical Park.
long_description: Discover Americaкs maritime heritage: board historic ships, tour the Maritime Museum, peruse our Visitor Center or collections at the Research Center.

name: John Fitzgerald Kennedy National Historic Site
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of John Fitzgerald Kennedy National Historic Site
long_description: "It was a nice old wooden frame house with clapboard siding, all on a small lot with a few bushes and trees. It would have blended into most main streets of America...our house, our first home is still there at 83 Beals Street." -Rose Fitzgerald Kennedy

name: Grand Teton National Park
short_description: Located in northwestern Wyoming, Grand Teton National Park preserves a spectacular landscape rich with majestic mountains, pristine lakes, and extraordinary wildlife.
long_description: Rising above a scene rich with extraordinary wildlife, pristine lakes, and alpine terrain, the Teton Range stands monument to the people who fought to protect it. These are mountains of the imagination. Mountains that led to the creation of Grand Teton National Park where you can explore over two hundred miles of trails, float the Snake River or enjoy the serenity of this remarkable place.

name: Herbert Hoover National Historic Site
short_description: The official Facebook account of Herbert Hoover National Historic Site
long_description: Born in a two-room cottage, Herbert Hoover could have been any small town boy. Orphaned at age nine, he left West Branch, never to live here again. The landscape and buildings of the early years remain, however, to tell how family, faith, education, and hard work opened a world of opportunityг even the presidency of the United Statesг to a child of simple beginnings.

name: Point Reyes National Seashore
short_description: This is the official Facebook account for Point Reyes National Seashore.
long_description: From its thunderous ocean breakers crashing against rocky headlands and expansive sand beaches to its open grasslands, brushy hillsides and forested ridges, Point Reyes offers visitors over 1000 species of plants and animals to discover. Home to several cultures over thousands of years, the Seashore preserves a tapestry of stories and interactions of people. Point Reyes awaits your exploration.

name: Valley Forge National Historical Park
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of Valley Forge National Historical Park
long_description: Valley Forge National Historical Park is nationally significant as the location of the 1777-78 winter encampment of the Continental Army under General George Washington. Few places evoke the spirit of patriotism and independence, represent individual and collective sacrifice, or demonstrate the resolve, tenacity and determination of the people of the United States to be free as does Valley Forge. The historic landscapes, structures, objects, and archaeological and natural resources at Valley Forge are tangible links to one of the most defining events in our nationкs history Here the Continental Army under Washington's leadership emerged as a cohesive and disciplined fighting force. The Valley Forge experience is fundamental to both American history and American myth, and remains a source of inspiration for Americans and the world.

name: NPS National Capital Region Network Inventory & Monitoring
short_description: This is the official Facebook page of the National Capital Region Network, Inventory & Monitoring program.
long_description:
NCRN I&M is dedicated to improving park management through greater reliance on scientific information. We conduct long-term monitoring of natural resources including water quality, forest vegetation, and wildlife in National Parks of the greater Washington, DC region.

NCRN I&M serves 11 park units in Virginia, West Virginia, Maryland, and the District of Columbia that share common natural resources. The parks are:
Antietam National Battlefield (MD)
Catoctin Mountain Park (MD)
Chesapeake and Ohio Canal National Historical Park (DC, MD)
George Washington Memorial Parkway (DC, MD, VA)
Harpers Ferry National Historical Park (MD, VA, WV)
Manassas National Battlefield Park (VA)
Monocacy National Battlefield (MD)
National Capital Parks - East (DC, MD)
Prince William Forest Park (VA)
Rock Creek Park (DC)
Wolf Trap National Park for the Performing Arts (VA)

name: Selma to Montgomery National Historic Trail
short_description: The official Facebook account of the Selma to Montgomery NHT.
long_description:
The Selma to Montgomery National Historic Trail was established by Congress in 1996 to commemorate the events, people, and route of the 1965 Voting Rights March in Alabama. 

The 54-mile trail follows the historic march by beginning at the Brown Chapel AME Church in Selma and crossing the Edmund Pettus Bridge. As they crossed the bridge, the nonviolent marchers were stopped and beaten by law enforcement officers in what came to be known as –Bloody Sunday” on March 7, 1965. Outraged protesters from around the country joined the marchers for a subsequent five-day march that began in Selma on March 21, 1965, this time with state and federal law enforcement protection.

25,000 marchers concluded the historic march in Montgomery on March 25, with many notable speakers addressing the crowd at a concluding rally near the capitol building; Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. gave one of his most famous speeches at the rally. The Voting Rights Act was signed on August 6, 1965.

name: Lake Roosevelt National Recreation Area NPS
short_description: The official Facebook page for the Lake Roosevelt National Recreation Area.
long_description: The mighty Columbia River has drawn people to its waters for over 9,000 years. Historically the rich fishery of the river was used for survival and prosperity. Today Lake Roosevelt's visitors continue to enjoy the river's recreational offerings of camping, boating, fishing, and hunting from Coulee Dam to Kettle Falls. Visit Lake Roosevelt National Recreation Area and experience life on the river past and present.

short_description: The official Facebook account for the Ice Age Floods National Geologic Trail NPS.
long_description:
–At the end of the last Ice Age, some 12,000 to
17,000 years ago, a series of cataclysmic floods
occurred in what is now the northwest region
of the United States, leaving a lasting mark of
dramatic and distinguishing features on the
landscape of parts of the States of Montana,
Idaho, Washington, and Oregon.”

name: Hot Springs National Park
short_description: This is the official Facebook page of Hot Springs National Park, a park established to protect & preserve geothermal water for public use as a health resort & the only federally owned thermal springs spa.
long_description: Hot Springs National Park is the only national park that protects a unique combination of lithology, geologic structure and water sources that produce the only non-volcanic geothermal springs of such a high quality (e.g., temperature, taste, color, and odor) in the United States. This national park, first designated as a reservation by Congress in 1832, is the only unit of the National Park Service mandated to give away its primary natural resource, the geothermal water, to the general public in both an unending and unaltered state. Bathhouse Row within the park contains the largest collection of early 20th century bathhouses in the country.

short_description: Paterson Great Falls National Historical Park is one of the newest units of the National Park Service...and the newest in New Jersey.
long_description:
The story of Paterson and its Great Falls demonstrates that the natural and cultural diversity of the area helped fuel the economic and social growth of a young nation.

Over the next few years, the National Park Service (NPS) will be working with the City of Paterson, the Municipal Utility Authority, community organizations and interested people from nearby and across the county to create a common vision for the park's first 20 years.

name: Women's Rights National Historical Park
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of Women's Rights National Historical Park
long_description:
Seneca Falls, New York, became known as the birthplace of the formal women's rights movement in the United States when, in July of 1848, the First Womenкs Rights Convention was held. The "Declaration of Sentiments," adopted during the convention, and signed by 100 of the 300 attendees and provided the agenda for subsequent women's rights activity. 

Women's Rights National Historical Park was created by Congress in 1980 to preserve and interpret the nationally significant historical and cultural sites and structures associated with the struggle for equal rights for women.
 
The park consists of several buildings in Seneca Falls and nearby Waterloo, New York including the Hunt Home in Waterloo where the convention was planned; the M'Clintock Home in Waterloo where the Declaration of Sentiments was written; the Wesleyan Methodist Chapel in Seneca Falls where the convention was held; and the home of Elizabeth Cady Stanton in Seneca Falls.

name: Martin Van Buren National Historic Site
short_description: This is the official Facebook account of Martin Van Buren National Historic Site, located in Kinderhook, New York.
long_description:
The purpose of Martin Van Buren National Historic Site is to preserve Lindenwald so present and future generations of visitor will have an opportunity to learn about the life and public career of President Van Buren and find meaning in the issues facing America during the formative years of the republic through the turbulent decades leading to the Civil War.

President Van Buren lived at Lindenwald from 1841 until his death in July 1862. The household was lively with four adult sons, three of whom were married with children. The lives of domestic servants and farmhands are also part of the story here in Kinderhook, New York.  

Come to Columbia County and visit your National Park!

name: Glacier National Park
short_description: This is the official Flickr page of Glacier National Park.
long_description: Glacier National Park is located in northwest  Montana, on the Canada_United States border with the Canadian provinces of Alberta and British Columbia. The park encompasses over 1 million acres (4,000 km2) and includes parts of two mountain ranges, over 130 named lakes, more than 1,200 different species of plants, 700+ miles of trails, over 270 species of birds, and nearly 70 species of mammals. This vast pristine ecosystem is the centerpiece of what has been referred to as the "Crown of the Continent Ecosystem", a region of protected land encompassing 16,000 square miles (41,000 km2).

name: Marsh-Billings-Rockefeller National Historical Park Flickr Account
short_description: The official flickr account for Marsh-Billings-Rockefeller National Historical Park.
long_description: Nestled among the rolling hills and pastures of eastern-central Vermont, the Marsh-Billings-Rockefeller National Historical Park is the only national park to tell the story of conservation history and the evolving nature of land stewardship in America. The boyhood home of George Perkins Marsh, one of America's first conservationists, and later the home of Frederick Billings, the property was given to the American people by its most recent owners, Laurance S. and Mary F. Rockefeller. The park was created by an Act of Congress and signed into law by President George Bush on August 26, 1992. Under law, the purposes of the park are as follows:Today, the park is a living symbol of three generations of conservationist thought and practice.  The park seeks to put the idea of conservation stewardship into a modern context, interpreting the idea of place and the ways in which humans can balance natural resource conservation with the requirements of our twenty-first century world.
